COMMENT_TX: Christy Mathewson, President of BSN, missed opening day.  He was said to be slightly ill at Saranac Lake and would not risk the weather. Southworth was out sick, Groh had a head cold, Frisch's left hand was in constant pain. ML debut for Dave Harris and Jimmy Welsh
Tough grounder; Bancroft threw past 1B from awkward position
One of the longest hits ever made here; hit the CF fence on the fly 50' to the right of the scoreboard.
NYT: 'Gibson rumbled to the plate with all the speed of a glacier.'
Nehf knocked down the line drive at his head
Groh held up until it dropped
Rolled past the outfielders towards the flagpole
1-handed catch of tough play with the wind
Harris misjudged it then tried for a shoestring catch
Swinging bunt past the box; McNamara mussed it up
Youngs overran 2B and was run down
Braves argued the call by Ump McCormick at 1B.
Neis misjudged the wind-blown fly and made a spectacular, 1-handed over-the-shoulder grab close to the fence.
The outfield was swung around to RF
McGraw ran out on the game in the 8th so he could catch the 5 o'clock train for New York.  Hughey Jennings took over.
Wind-aided pop fly fell safely between Marquard and O'Neil
Brown briefly held up at 3B making play at plate close
Rifle shot rolled to the flagpole
Good scoop by Fournier of low throw
Bunted over Tierney as Cotton charged in
Petty lost a chance for DP after a moment of indecision
Harris tried a shoestring catch but it broke through him
Great try by Wheat who got the tips of his glove on it.
Scratch double; pop fly evaded Wheat and Mitchell
DWS: no CS on error in 1925
Fournier was trapped but got back to 3B when Marriott made a wild throw past Graham

Vance remained out of the batter's box to discuss with Ump O'Day the merits of a called strike so O'Day told Batchelder to go ahead and pitch; a second strike was called.  As Batch was about to put over the third one Dazzy hopped back into the box and took a swing at it.
Got past Johnston and rolled to the bleachers

NL Golden Jubilee celebtration today; Comm Landis, NL Pres Heydler, Gov Fuller, Mayor Curley, Braves VP Fuchs at ceremony raising the pennant celebrating 50 years of baseball.  Braves and Cubs were charter members of the original league in 1876 and are the only clubs which can boast an unbroken history in the organization. Also in attendance: players George Wright, Jack Manning, John Morrell, and Tom Bond, Umpire Bill McLean, and former Braves owner W. Conant.
Good squeeze bunt but Neis must have missed the sign and was trapped.  Alexander ran him down; Harris had made 2B but Marriott was forced to return to that bag, trapping Harris.
Miller loafed to allow the double
CDN: 'McAuley removed Harris'; may've been 63, but box score totals are correct with this scoring.
Struck Genewich's left ankle so hard the ball bounded beyond 3B.  Time had to be called to inspect the damage.
Marriott had to throw off balance and it arrived late
Close to LF line; Miller couldn't reach it
To deep RCF, toward the flagpole
Bad hop got away from Thomas

ej,killb101,M,wilsf901,Balls and strikes Cubs Manager Bill Killefer ejected by HP umpire Frank Wilson Killefer was so enraged that he stormed all over the place. The whole team surrounded Wilson to protest. Killefer was ejected by Ump Wilson.
Guessing timing and runner advancement; possibly PO2. BG: Cooney caught Statz off 2B and a poor throw by Smith to Marriott lost the chance to retire the runner.
Kaufmann had phenomenal speed and sharp curve today
Bad bounder deflected off Jacobs' glove to McAuley
Startling stop robbed him of a hit
Knocked it down with a leaping stop
Through Barnhart's legs to the fence
Great jumping catch after misjudging it due to the sun
Felix had failed to bunt earlier
Hit & run; Cuyler came in fast
Struck Wright's leg and caromed into the outfield
Thrilling, 1-handed juggling stop but Burrus beat throw
Morrison's throw was caught behind 2B by Moore who flipped to Wright for the force.
Marriott dove for the bag to beat Traynor

ej,smite106,P,riglc901,Arguing with spectator $Earl Smith was ejected for fighting with a fan. Angered by a continuing verbal attack by the fan in a box seat, Smith, who had just backed up the play at 1B, quickly climbed into the stands and struck the offender. 'That gent was on me all day.  He called me all sorts of names.  When I decided to go after him, I asked him to take off his glasses.  He took them off and I socked him in the  side of the neck.' Teammates ran to his assistance and a near riot ensued. Police and the umpires quelled the disturbance. As Smith neared the park exit, another irate rooter threw a chair that struck him, inflicting a gash on his forehead which required medical attention.  NY Times version: The trouble started when Smith ran toward the grandstand for a foul fly which he failed to catch.  He became embroiled in an argument with W.J. Lewis of Boston, a spectator.  They were preparing to 'mix' when onlookers said Smith struck the spectator a glancing blow.  Police and others intervened and Smith was ordered from the game as the crowd swarmed onto the field.  As he passed down the steps to the visiting team's quarters beneath the grandstand, a chair, thrown by an unidentified spectator, landed on top of him.  The police had difficulty for a time in handling the crowd. Boston Globe: The heckling of Smith began after he had run into Burrus at first base.  For this Smith was not to blame.
Bancroft had sent two liners down LF line and started around the bases but both were blown foul by inches.
Smith rounded 2B before the catch and was easily doubled
Bancroft muffed throw to 2B; it rolled into CF
Ball hit the bag and hopped far into foul territory
Fast fielding held Gooch to single
Gooch disputed close play at plate with Ump Hart
Mgr McKechnie disputed the call at 1B; it appeared Ump McLaughlin had erred.

Originally ruled an out by McLaughlin; Bancroft protested so McLaughlin asked Rigler for a ruling and Cy reversed McLaughlin's call; evidently Moore either pulled his foot early or juggled the ball.  Moore then made a big protest.
Very close play on relay throw to 1B
During this AB Grantham almost made a great catch of a foul down RF line.
Deflected off of Adams's bare hand to Wright
Thrilling play by Barnhart, Wright, and Traynor nipped Smith
Bancroft had fouled off a number of pitches
Very close play at 3B on Welsh's fine throw
It looked as if Barnhart missed the plate; O'Neil and Bancroft protested violently.
Fine bare-handed stop; brilliant attempt at force, but threw wide past Moore.
Welsh tried for a 1-handed scooping catch but it got by him
Fine stop but poor throw to Donohue at 1B caused a collision with Welsh, allowing Harris to score.
Gibson reached out on the intentional ball and poked it to LF
Shot through Bancroft before he could get his hands down
Benton replaced with 2-0 count; charge this BB to him
Caveney pulled a leg ligament getting away from the plate
Diving catch, took a triple away
Bancroft threw the relay to the stands
BG: 'Marquard kicked like a steer at being taken out'
Ryan chucked it into RF foul territory
Marriott missed the tag on Critz
Neis let it go through him (Neis was playing the sun field field today because of Welsh's injured ankle).
Bare-handed stop over 2B; robbed of hit

Phenomenal 1-handed jumping catch.  Mueller crashed into the wall and fell like a log but hung on.  He was down until a few teammates ran out and picked him up; he was able to walk to the bench and continue in the game.
SLS reported O'Neil with this groundout to end the inning, but then they skipped over Cooney's 7th inning AB as if BSN batted out of turn.
To deep RCF; mighty wallop carried on the fly into the RCF corner, away beyond the bleachers. One of the longest drives ever seen here.
High against the LCF scoreboard, on the batting order side. A slightly higher elevation would have cleared it, a feat never yet performed at Braves Field.
Dropped it after a hard run; got both hands on it but should have caught it against his chest.
Ordinary single took a crazy hop, hurdled Mueller, and rolled nearly to the CF fence. Siemer's 1st ML hit and only career HR.
Over Felix to deep CF fence
Hartley pulled up at 3B before deciding to race home
Jackson had rounded 1B but was doubled while going back
Kamp ran over to 1B for the out
Great play; nearly knocked Jackson off his pins
Felix lost it in the sun
Meusel took 3B and Lindstom 2B when Neis fumbled
Tried to steal while Nehf held the ball
The wind carried it over Harris
Lindstrom was spiked on the left forearm as he tagged Neis, dropping the ball; time was taken while the arm was dressed.
First player ever to clear LF fence on the fly here. It cleared the fence by 20 ft and was about 15 ft inside the foul line.  The wind favored it.
O'Neil was hit on the foot; guessing PO
Fournier was out between 2B & 3B; NYTEM/352 had 1X3(756) but
To the flagpole; Ryan's only ML HR and final career RBI
When it began to rain during Taylor's AB, the Robins started to hurry the game along.  The last 5 innings were played in a steady drizzle.

The first homer by a Braves player over LF fence in the history of the park, and only the second player ever (Frank Snyder did it earlier this year).  The wind was blowing strongly out, but it was a terrific drive. The ball cleared the top of the fence by 50 feet midway between the scoreboard and foul line.  Snyder's hit was 50 feet closer to LCF but cleared the fence by 10-12 feet. Wind conditions for both HRs were similar.
Padgett's throw hit Smith on the shoulder; caromed into RF
Flack tried for a shoestring catch
Ordinary single skidded past Shinners and rolled to the scoreboard. Barnes' first/only ML HR.
Cooney batted it down as it streaked to RF
High throw but error charged to Padgett
Caromed off Sothoron's leg and rebounded towards the plate; he limped after it, and his throw home was late.
Cooney fell down holding Harris' grounder
ej,marqr102,P,mccob104,Balls and strikes Marquard ejected by Ump McCormick for protesting a third called ball on Bottomley.
During this AB, Toporcer popped an easy foul that the wind carried just out of Bancroft's reach.
During this AB, Burrus failed to collect O'Farrell's pop foul due to the wind.
Cooney's throw hit Smith in the back and caromed to RF
Great catch; wind brought it back toward SS
Great diving, rolling catch; one of the greatest ever seen at Braves Field.
Benton failed to take Burrus's assist
Great catch; would've been HR in any other NL park

Shriners Day; they presented souvenirs to brother members on both clubs: Bancroft, Burrus, Mann, Gibson; Wingo, Rixey, Roush, Bassler.  Gov Fuller was with Shriners in the stands. ML debut for Abie Hood (BSN/2B)
Swinging bunt 6' in front of plate; threw into RF
Hood's 1st ML chance.  Sharply hit; bad hop hit him in leg.
Smith took away a sure hit and continued to 1B for unassisted DP.
Almost everyone but the umpire thought it was strike three
Harris bumped Caveney making him throw wild to 1B
Low throw home in the dirt; Marriott muffed Gibson's throw
Fine diving catch (some thought it was trapped)
'Cooney was given a 2-base hit on a ball that got through the infield.'
Great catch of near Texas Leaguer
High/wide throw past 1B on swinging bunt topper
Over Cuyler who crashed into the fence chasing after it
Fluke double over Barnhart who seemed to have it all the way but it blew over him.
Neis was out attempting to score when Morrison tried to pickoff Marriott at 1B
Welsh was bothered by the sun
To the flagpole in deep CF
Gibson injured his hand on a foul tip by Barnhart
Cuyler waited for Marriott to throw to 1B before racing home.  Burrus seemed to pass up a play at the plate.
Brilliant assist; with 3-2 count, runners were on the move
Fast play; wonderfully accurate throw home nipped Burrus
Texas Leaguer fell between Hood and Welsh
To deep RCF; close play at the plate. Hood's 1st/only ML HR.
Dropped a fly in front of Moore
Ump McLaughlin called Hood out, then safe. He appealed to Ump Rigler who called him out.  Mgr Bancroft protested.
Knocked down the liner with a diving leap
DP throw to 1B was too late, in part because Hood was shifted toward 1B hole.

Very close play at 3B; Harris was playing in and toward the line, but his throw was off-line.  Marriott came off the bag to catch it, then dove at the runner sliding in to 3B.  Ump Wilson claimed Marriott missed the tag.
Gibson threw high to Bancroft whose return throw was also high and Bigbee was called safe.
McInnis tried to score in the mixup at 1B; Graham had taken the throw from Burrus.  Close plays at 1B and home.
Over Felix who was playing short CF to cut off winning run
Yde was boxed; Gautreau dropped a throw.  Other assists possible during rundown.
Great play by Yde who finished it with a 1-handed catch @ 1B
Moore tried to tag Mann but in the mix-up the ball was jostled out of his hand.
Spectacular stop of ugly smash behind 1B
Bancroft muffed the popup but Harris recovered for the force
Over Carey but nailed at 3B by spectacular fielding

Cuyler had cleared the bases with a drive into the extreme corner of LF; Ump McLaughlin called it fair but after the Braves protested, he deferred to Ump Rigler who ruled foul. The Pirates then turned in a long protest to no avail.
Attempted double steal; Moore tried for 2B while Cooney held ball.  When Cooney turned toward 2B, Carey came home.
Wonderful running barehanded stop saved a run
DWS: no CS on error in 1925
Bancroft fouled off two squeeze bunts prior to grounder
Brilliant knockdown by Moore; McInnis held on after Welsh collided with him at 1B.
First ML start on the mound for utility infielder Bob Smith
Landed on LF line according to umps; long discussion ensued
Welsh muffed the fly ball but got the force
Circus stop by Burrus who tagged Smith
Welsh's throw to 3B seemed to beat Wright but the runner bumped into the ball in some manner and was safe.
Jones blindly threw to 3B with nobody covering
Slid threw Grigsby's hands and rolled to the scoreboard
SB while Seimer was returning throw to Vargus
Hit to the scoreboard, but for some unaccountable reason pulled up at 1B.
Running catch close to the fence
Hard, high bounder through the box
Burrus tried to score on a high delivery by Greenfield. Snyder batted it down and got it in time to run him down.
Bounced off Graham's glove; would've been an easy out had he let it go through to Bancroft.
Game receipts donated to Salvation Army's Fresh Air Camp (home for poor children) in Sharon, MA.
As Bancroft stepped to bat he was presented with a gold watch by players and officials of Boston.
It landed between Frisch and Meusel, then bounced awkwardly past Irish and rolled through Southworth.
'Frisch tarried overlong and threw leisurely...the Holy Cross speedster beating the ball by the span of a grasshopper's ankle.'
Wide throw to 1B; it was a difficult play
Burrus tried to duck a wild pitch and popped over 3B
Welsh's throw to 3B got by Padgett
Off Reinhart's foot and spurted past Bottomley
Spectacular diving slide into 3B by Welsh
Bottomley fumbled hot grounder; ruled hit
Swinging bunt; Haines tagged out Burrus
Gautreau dropped throw but picked it up in time for force
Hafey missed shoestring catch; ball rolled to fence
Welch accused Mails of deliberately hitting him and started towards the pitcher as though to start something.  Players and umpires separated them without any damage being done.
Pie Traynor Day at Braves Field; he received numerous gifts before the game from the home folks of Somerville, MA.
To the scoreboard Traynor received a mighty ovation as he stepped to the plate
Grantham was boxed and run down

Ump Rigler called Rawlings out after Johnny had slid past the plate.  The play was not close as far as the position of the ball was concerned, but the alert O'Neil took the bounding sphere and tagged Rawlings after the whole play seemed to be over.  Rigler, in the opinion of many, was tricked by O'Neil's stunt.  From the press box Rawling's foot seemed to get almost half of the plate.  The unexpected ruling threw the Pirates in an uproar.

Burrus overran 1B; Braves protested Rigler's call at home, claiming Gooch juggled it as Mann came in and failed to tag him.  Mann sidestepped Gooch and touched the plate from behind without going three feet out of line to do so.
Meadows was injured covering 1B but stayed in the game
Burrus avoided Traynor's tag; Pirates claimed he ran out of the line but Ump Hart disallowed it.
ej,bancd101,M,riglc901,Balls and strikes With Wilson up, Manager Bancroft, coaching 3B, was ejected by Ump Rigler for disputing a pitch decision.
Bounded over Padgett and off his glove
Running catch; difficult play with Wright/Rawlings nearby
Stopped it with his body and held it to a single
To the flagpole; Felix misjudged it
Single took high hop over Welsh
High fly dropped between Weis and Adams
Nice stop of high bounder 10' back of 2B; just getting to it was quite a play as he jumped to reach it, but making the long accurate throw while running into the outfield was marvelous.
Deflected off Graham's shins to Burrus
To the flagpole, the farthest most point in CF
High was trapped but Freigau threw wild
Great stop by Welsh held Rabbit to 2B

Came in fast. ej,marar101,M,klemb901,Bench jockeying $Cubs Manager Rabbit Maranville ejected by HP umpire Bill Klem for remarks at the arbiter.  With Coach Gibson on a scouting tour, Charlie Grimm took command.

Stock couldn't hold backhanded catch of low liner or else would have started triple play.  Ford tried to save Stock's hurried wild throw by jumping in front of Wilson as the latter slid into the bag, then fell writhing from pain in his badly spiked left foot.  He was carried off the field. Wilson was also shaken up and limped around for a few minutes before being replaced.
Hit on the top of the head
0-2 count when Wilson was sent up to bat for Burrus
Singled through infield which was looking for the bunt
